intro: Daviesia nudula, commonly known as the slender daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually simple and pinnate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Daviesia nudula is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
